China: The Qing dynasty signed the Treaty of Nerchinsk with Russia, under which the two countries mutually agreed to a border at the Stanovoy Range.
Latvia: The Old and New Testaments were published in Latvian translation by Pastor Ernst Glück.
Philippine: Alonso de Avila Fuertes appointed Governor-General (1689–1690) by the Audiencia Real
Russia: Fyodor Shaklovity, the head of the Streltsy Department, persuaded Sophia to proclaim herself tsarina and attempted to ignite a new rebellion in her support. The streltsy instead defected in support of Peter. Shaklovity was executed.
